list.name: Default
list.comment: metrics_analyzer.py, configurator.py, alerter.py: - The code that makes printing of debug messages depended on a constant need a special import in python2.7 - ADDED

task.summary: Default task
metric_analyzer.py: - I found out that Logstash is sending the service multiple metrics in one go which exceeds the 4K buffer so in this version I try to get all the data from the network stream.
metric_analyzer.py: - Used a broader exception handler to prevent the failure of the entire thread
metric_analyzer.py: - Added debug message that contains the entire raw message received by the server
metric_analyzer.py: - Trying to rebuild the message parsing code to support messages that span over multiple buffers
metric_analyzer.py: - Trying to rebuild the message parsing code to support messages that span over multiple buffers
metric_analyzer.py: - Trying to rebuild the message parsing code to support messages that span over multiple buffers
metric_analyzer.py: - Set the code that writes debug messages about the metrics being received to be depended on the DEBUG constant to try and lower the memory consumption of the service
metric_analyzer.py: - Lowered the allowed number of loaded models to minimize the memory consumption of the service.
metric_analyzer.py: - Switched from the TCP server approach to the Kafka consumer approach: the service will now consume the metrics directly from Kafka
metric_analyzer.py: - Configured the unit file to load the metric-analyzer only after kafka is loaded
metric_analyzer.py: - Accidently used the consumer record as-is without extracting the value from it first
metric_analyzer.py: - The message about exceeding the models quota repeated all the time. Fixed

configurator.py: - Added configuration for a kafka topic that will be used for sending the anomaly reports by the metrics analyzer
metric_analyzer.py: - Added code for reporting anomalies found in metrics to Kafka as well as to the alerter. This will allow other services to handle other aspects of the alerts and at least for now will help me debug the service.\
metrics_collector.py, timer.py: - Added extra info to the ping result to help detect problems in the service.
test_service_status.sh: - Added the infrastructure services (kafka, zookeeper, logstash)
metric_analyzer.py: - Removed all commented out tcp server stuff - Added more info on why the service is waiting on load

metrics_collector.py: - Added first version of a tokenizing mechanism for tokenizing long metric elements to prevent file name too long errors.
so-clean_all.sh - A script for cleaning the system from all the metrics, topics info, tasks, etc. (in the future also passwords) to prepare it for deployments
metrics_collector.py: -
so-clean_all.sh: - Deleting the topics instead of just purging them
Just updated permissions

so-update: - Added git stash to prevent the update from failing because of local changes
so-clean_all: - Added code for cleaning up StatsD

anomaly_detector: - Added information about the anomalies reported in the logs and in the /ping result
so-clean_all: - Added informational messages
so-stat: - Added script for testing all the system services status

timer.py: - Added more info to the logs and the /ping method.
test_services_status.sh - Added --quiet mode
so-clean.sh, so-update: - Using the quiet mode of test_services_status
metrics_analyzer.py: - prevented the service from processing its own output again
metrics_collector.py: - Added timestamp column to the tokenizer table to allow for building a garbage collector later that will remove old entries

metrics_analyzer.py: - Added debug message that should explain why the service supposedly handles metrics that were created by it.
*.service: - Set the service load order ("After=") correctly
so-stat.sh, test_services_status.sh: - Added statsd and other infrastructure services to the list.
metrics_analyzer.py: - Hopefully, realized why the service kept handling its own metrics and causing a loop. Hopefully - fixed it.
metrics_collector.py: - Fixed a null-ref error

so-clean_all.sh: - Restarting statsd after cleanup (a must)
so-stat.sh: - Added information about the metrics that are in statsd
queries.json: - Queries that needed both certificate name and source IP used bro_x509 type which lacks information about the source ips. Changed to use bro_ssl.

queries.json: - Configured all queries that used base64 not to use it anymore.
detokenize.py: - Added script for retrieving the actual parameter based on the token
metrics_collector.py: - Fixed thread sync issues.
so-update.sh: - Added another command to start kafka because it seems to fail quite often after start for some reason.
queries.json: - Removed all base64 usage
queries.json: - Fixed an issue that sometimes could use the doc_count that has been returned from elastic as the argument for the query even when it wasn't necessary.
queries.json: - Whooopsie... (-:

metrics_collector.py: - Rewrote the Utils().GenerateLldFromElasticAggrRes() method in different approach (iterative and not recursive) to support the usage with Gunicorn and to simplify the code and improve performance (it used to create a Zabbix LLD and then convert it again to contain the URLs, now it does everything at once)
metrics_collector.py: - Removed commented out code of the old GenerateLLD - Changed the code to use UTC when setting ranges and alike in Elasticsearch queries

alerter.py, configurator.py: - Added preparation for usage of Gunicorn and some service specific info in /ping methods
metrics_analyzer.py, metrics_collector.py, timer.py: - Added code for synchronizing the service specific info between all the worker threads to make /ping results more accurate
anomaly_detector.py: - Preparing for metrics discovery by collecting a list of unique metric names directly from Kafka. (to minimize latency and IOPS involved in filesystem enumeration)

configuration.py: - Added config for the code in the anomaly_detector service (for detecting anomalies automatically on a scheduled basis and reporting them)
metrics_analyzer.py: - Now uses a configured regex pattern to find which metrics should be processed by the service - Added unique id for each report. (will allow the Alerter to receive alerts both directly via HTTP and via Kafka and de-dupe the list)
anomaly_detector.py: - Moved many of the global constants to the configuration - Added a Kafka producer for sending out alerts about detected anomalies - Added a thread for continuously discovering metrics by subscribing to the metrics topic on Kafka and de-duping the input into a dictionary. - Rewritten the report_anomaly method to match the format and the techniques used in the metrics-analyzer. - Protecting against attempts for path traversal - Replaced code that was located within the class in class methods that created new instances of the class with the call to "self."
metrics_collector.py, timer.py, tinyurl.py: - Added the exception type in error messages in generic exception handlers.
so-update.sh: - Added cleanup of all the metrics stored in the StatsD cache at every update (to prevent ghost metrics)
metrics_collector.py: - There was a bug that prevented the collector from tokenizing arguments in the metric name - The URLs that were created during discovery were not url-encoded
timer.py: - The /ping result included the raw Value object.

metrics_collector.py: - Fixed "UnboundLocalError: local variable 'element_token' referenced before assignment" in file "/opt/smart-onion/code/backend/python3_5/services/metrics_collector/metrics_collector.py", line 730, in resolve_query_args_in_metric_name

metrics_analyzer.py: - For some reason the metrics-analyzer doesn't analyze metrics. Added more info to the /ping request and to the logs.
anomaly_detector.py - Added more counters to the /ping method to allow monitoring the service health
anomaly_detector.py - Whooopsie....
metrics_analyzer.py - Whooopsie....

metrics_analyzer.py - Added code for extracting the metric name for the purpose of matching it against the regex and writing it to the logs
anomaly_detector.py: - Added more info in the /ping to help find out why the service is not functioning
anomaly_detector.py: - Forgot to decode the metrics as they arrive from Kafka

anomaly_detector.py: - The method get_anomaly_score() is designed to accept calls via Bottle URLs so instead of calling it directly - using urllib to call it via HTTP.
configurator.py: - Added configuration that will help the anomaly-detector service call itself for detecting anomalies in metrics

anomaly_detector.py: - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant - The condition that checks whether the metric name appears in the unique metrics list was incorrectly written - Added try-except block around the addition to the uniqe metrics list to detect issues that prevent the service from working properly now.
metrics_analyzer.py: - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant
configurator.py: - Added configuration of the path to the fonts that are going to be used in the similarity tests
metrics_collector.py: - Fixed an issue with the visual similarity test: it used to refer to fonts at /home/yuval/.fonts which obviously did not exist in production. Now uses a path from the config - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant - Added state variable to help identify exception causes
timer.py, tinyurl.py: - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn
metrics_analyzer.py, configurator.py, alerter.py: - The code that makes printing of debug messages depended on a constant need a special import in python2.7 - ADDED
